t: Luke 21
The Widow’s Two Mites
And*p He looked up and saw the rich putting their gifts into the treasury,
and He saw also a certain poor widow putting in two mites.
So He said, “Truly*r I*r say*r to*r you*r that*r this*r poor*r widow*r has*r put*r in*r more*r than*r all;*r
for*r all*r these*r out*r of*r their*r abundance*r have*r put*r in*r offerings*r for*r God,*r but*r she*r out*r of*r her*r poverty*r put*r in*r all*r the*r livelihood*r that*r she*r had.”*r
Jesus Predicts the Destruction of the Temple
Then,*p as some spoke of the temple, how it was adorned with beautiful stones and donations, He said,
“These*r things*r which*r you*r see—the*r days*r will*r come*r in*r which*r not*r one*ir stone*r shall*r be*r left*r upon*r another*r that*r shall*r not*r be*r thrown*r down.”*r
The Signs of the Times and the End of the Age
So*p they asked Him, saying, “Teacher, but when will these things be? And what sign will*i there*i be*i when these things are about to take place?”

And*p He said: “Take*r heed*r that*r you*r not*r be*r deceived.*r For*r many*r will*r come*r in*r My*r name,*r saying,*r ‘I*r am*r He,’*ir and,*r ‘The*r time*r has*r drawn*r near.’*r Therefore*r do*r not*r go*r after*r them.*r

But*r when*r you*r hear*r of*r wars*r and*r commotions,*r do*r not*r be*r terrified;*r for*r these*r things*r must*r come*r to*r pass*r first,*r but*r the*r end*r will*ir not*r come*ir immediately.”*r
Then*p He said to them, “Nation*r will*r rise*r against*r nation,*r and*r kingdom*r against*r kingdom.*r
And*r there*r will*r be*r great*r earthquakes*r in*r various*r places,*r and*r famines*r and*r pestilences;*r and*r there*r will*r be*r fearful*r sights*r and*r great*r signs*r from*r heaven.*r

But*r before*r all*r these*r things,*r they*r will*r lay*r their*r hands*r on*r you*r and*r persecute*r you,*ir delivering*r you*ir up*r to*r the*r synagogues*r and*r prisons.*r You*r will*r be*r brought*r before*r kings*r and*r rulers*r for*r My*r name’s*r sake.*r
But*r it*r will*r turn*r out*r for*r you*r as*r an*r occasion*r for*r testimony.*r
Therefore*r settle*r it*ir in*r your*r hearts*r not*r to*r meditate*r beforehand*r on*r what*r you*r will*r answer;*r
for*r I*r will*r give*r you*r a*r mouth*r and*r wisdom*r which*r all*r your*r adversaries*r will*r not*r be*r able*r to*r contradict*r or*r resist.*r
You*r will*r be*r betrayed*r even*r by*r parents*r and*r brothers,*r relatives*r and*r friends;*r and*r they*r will*r put*r some*ir of*r you*r to*r death.*r
And*r you*r will*r be*r hated*r by*r all*r for*r My*r name’s*r sake.*r
But*r not*r a*r hair*r of*r your*r head*r shall*r be*r lost.*r
By*r your*r patience*r possess*r your*r souls.*r
The Destruction of Jerusalem
“But*rp when*r you*r see*r Jerusalem*r surrounded*r by*r armies,*r then*r know*r that*r its*r desolation*r is*r near.*r

Then*r let*r those*r who*r are*r in*r Judea*r flee*r to*r the*r mountains,*r let*r those*r who*r are*r in*r the*r midst*r of*r her*r depart,*r and*r let*r not*r those*r who*r are*r in*r the*r country*r enter*r her.*r

But*r woe*r to*r those*r who*r are*r pregnant*r and*r to*r those*r who*r are*r nursing*r babies*r in*r those*r days!*r For*r there*r will*r be*r great*r distress*r in*r the*r land*r and*r wrath*r upon*r this*r people.*r

And*r they*r will*r fall*r by*r the*r edge*r of*r the*r sword,*r and*r be*r led*r away*r captive*r into*r all*r nations.*r And*r Jerusalem*r will*r be*r trampled*r by*r Gentiles*r until*r the*r times*r of*r the*r Gentiles*r are*r fulfilled.*r

“And*rp there*r will*r be*r signs*r in*r the*r sun,*r in*r the*r moon,*r and*r in*r the*r stars;*r and*r on*r the*r earth*r distress*r of*r nations,*r with*r perplexity,*r the*r sea*r and*r the*r waves*r roaring;*r

men’s*r hearts*r failing*r them*r from*r fear*r and*r the*r expectation*r of*r those*r things*r which*r are*r coming*r on*r the*r earth,*r for*r the*r powers*r of*r the*r heavens*r will*r be*r shaken.*r

Now*r when*r these*r things*r begin*r to*r happen,*r look*r up*r and*r lift*r up*r your*r heads,*r because*r your*r redemption*r draws*r near.”*r
The Parable of the Fig Tree
Then*p He spoke to them a parable: “Look*r at*r the*r fig*r tree,*r and*r all*r the*r trees.*r
When*r they*r are*r already*r budding,*r you*r see*r and*r know*r for*r yourselves*r that*r summer*r is*r now*r near.*r
So*r you*r also,*r when*r you*r see*r these*r things*r happening,*r know*r that*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God*r is*r near.*r
Assuredly,*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r this*r generation*r will*r by*r no*r means*r pass*r away*r till*r all*r things*r take*r place.*r
Heaven*r and*r earth*r will*r pass*r away,*r but*r My*r words*r will*r by*r no*r means*r pass*r away.*r
The Importance of Watching

“But*rp take*r heed*r to*r yourselves,*r lest*r your*r hearts*r be*r weighed*r down*r with*r carousing,*r drunkenness,*r and*r cares*r of*r this*r life,*r and*r that*r Day*r come*r on*r you*r unexpectedly.*r
For*r it*r will*r come*r as*r a*r snare*r on*r all*r those*r who*r dwell*r on*r the*r face*r of*r the*r whole*r earth.*r

Watch*r therefore,*r and*r pray*r always*r that*r you*r may*r be*r counted*r worthy*r to*r escape*r all*r these*r things*r that*r will*r come*r to*r pass,*r and*r to*r stand*r before*r the*r Son*r of*r Man.”*r
And*p in the daytime He was teaching in the temple, but at night He went out and stayed on the mountain called Olivet.
Then early in the morning all the people came to Him in the temple to hear Him.
